title: Ingrid Bergman
summary: Ingrid Bergman[lower-alpha 1] (29 August 1915 – 29 August 1982) was a Swedish actress who starred in a variety of European and American films, television movies, and plays.[1] With a career spanning five decades,[2] she is often regarded as one of the most influential screen figures in cinematic history.[3] She won numerous accolades, including three Academy Awards, two Primetime Emmy Awards, a Tony Award, four Golden Globe Awards, and a BAFTA Award. She is one of only three actresses to have received three acting Academy Awards (only Katharine Hepburn has four).
